intro: Pharmacum samoense, commonly known as the Samoan pharmacum, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Samoa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its potential medicinal uses, it has been of interest to botanists and pharmacologists.
